answers.author: Christopher Anderson
answers.text:
The pipeline will pass by our community, with one of the major pumping stations about 3 miles outside of town. There are a couple of loud voices of opposition. It appears the vast majority have no strong opinion. Our Mayor sent a letter of support for the project and our County Board has also.

author: Keith Bergman
text: For those managers in communities along the proposed pipeline route in Alberta, Saskatchewan, Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Oklahoma, and Texas . . . how do your citizens view the impacts of the Keystone XL (Tar Sands) pipeline and how are you dealing with those issues?
title: Keystone XL (Tar Sands) Pipeline
